data.title: Johnny Depp beat Tom Hanks, Tom Cruise, and Michael Jackson for ‘Edward Scissorhands’ role
data.text:
Tim Burton’s classic 1990 film Edward Scissorhands almost cast these A-listers, but Johnny Depp’s skills won.

Read also: ‘Kalki 2898 AD’ trailer: Prabhas’ sci-fi extravaganza ignites ‘Dune’-like madness; Watch

Hollywood biggies Tom Hanks, Michael Jackson, as well as Tom Cruise were reportedly being considered to play the fan-favorite role of Edward Scissorhands even before Johnny Depp stepped in.

According to People, Johnny Depp in a new docuseries recalled that playing the title role in Edward Scissorhands felt like “exactly what I should be doing.”

The 61-year-old actor who ultimately landed the role of the loving outcast beat out some of the biggest names in the industry for his breakout Edward Scissorhands lead role.

Depp in his interview in Tara Wood’s still-untitled documentary revealed that Tim Burton’s 1990 gothic fantasy almost cast Tom Hanks and Michael Jackson, whereas Tom Cruise was not “far away from actually playing Edward Scissorhands — true story.”

The Academy Award nominee said Tim Burton and Caroline Thompson’s script “passed through everything, anything, solid and went to the very core of whatever I am.” Calling the writing and the character beautiful, he added, “What I suppose [attracted] me emotionally was that Edward was me. It’s exactly what I should be doing.”

“He’s never going to cast me when everyone in Hollywood is after the part,” Depp recalled. “Tim’s really juggling because he’s getting hit by his agent, the studio, everybody. So I called my agent after reading the script and said, ‘Please cancel the meeting, I’m not going’.”

The actor continued her agent was not happy and said, “‘Are you f***ing nuts?’” He revealed, “It was weird because there’s always that bastard in your skull that goes ‘Come on, man. You’re a TV actor guy.’ Because at that time it was almost either-or.”

Johnny Depp then “finally gave in” and met with Tim Burton. He got the part and ultimately earned his first Golden Globe nomination for the same.

Edward Scissorhands also starred Winona Ryder as Kim, the local woman’s daughter who Edward falls in love with.

Meanwhile, Johnny Depp has since worked with Tim Burton on several projects including Ed Wood (1994), Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (2005), Corpse Bride (2005), Alice in Wonderland (2010), and more.
